p: Independently to the dietary treatment, the weight of the eggs produced by quails in the present experiment was higher (14.5 g) than values commonly found in literature [ 18]. Birds of the present study were almost at the end of their productive career, whereas most research studies considered 8â€“12 weeks-old birds [ 33]. In quails, egg weight was reported to increase up to 12 weeks of age then remain stable, with different lines, feeding and management strategies determining a certain variability in this sense [ 17].
